page.title: 02BISHOPS ITCHINGTON (cont'd)
page.content: village'. Main sewerage and electricity were connected and both private and public housing built. The population doubled and the village became dormitory to{Coventry}and {Leamington. Geographically, the parish is contained in a saucer-shaped depression on the line between the{ {Cotswolds}and the{Avon valley.}The Itchen's extensive meanders produce well-watered grassland: the higher sandy ground is ploughed. The village is a pleasant mixture of old and new both in buildings and population; very self-contained, its older families rather insular. The bus service is very restricted and non-car families can feel rather trapped. The 'new' villagers came in mostly from the Coventry and Leamington areas during the 196Os.
